name: sanguinaria-canadensis
light: Deep shade (Less than 2 hours to no direct sunlight)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
fruit-description: Fruits are green pods with brown seeds that become available April-May.
flower-description: 1.5-2" bright white flowers, 8 to 12 petals.  Two sepals fall away as flower opens. Flowers bloom March-April.
leaf-description: 6", five to nine lobed leaf with blunt teeth, persists until mid-summer
poison-symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, faintness, dizziness, dilated pupils, fainting, diarrhea, heart failure
uses: Red sap was used for dye for baskets, clothing, and war paint, as as an insect repellent.
